intro: Tridynamia sinensis var. sinensis, commonly known as Chinese tridynamia, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white or yellowish flowers are borne in clusters at the top of the stems. Tridynamia sinensis var. sinensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine.
